activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8758
activity.text:
> @Sulochan-khadka Can't we follow the same implementation as in Live Patients?

I thought the same initially, but do not know why it was not done before. I also wanted to know the significance of Paginated List component . @rithviknishad , it would be great if you explain a bit about this....

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#8758
activity.text:
> This is not the right way to achieve it. `Pagination` component is a generic component and shouldn't rely on the URL's search param `page` for the state and logic. A dashboard like UI (such as consultation dashboard), may have multiple pagination components present in a single view. And these page states would be managed internally and not on the search params.

I definitely know that this is not the best approach one can have. But the pagination in the discharged section is not handled neatly.
Pagination in Live Patients is handled through "Pagination" from "filters" which uses "PaginationComponent" whereas in Discharged Patients , it is handled through "PaginatedList" which uses "Paginator" which uses "Pagination" different from the former mentioned.

Therefore, i saw that this works fine. Therefore pushed it. 

Kindly suggest me an alternative way to solve this.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7382
activity.text: @rithviknishad this has been solved by probably two ways. Since Combobox.input does not explicitly support this type of styling , 2 ways seemed to me to get it solved. The easiest way to get this solved was to use any pre-worked feature / library (increasing dependencies), while the other way round was to create from scratch, by working on the stylings , modifying some, and then achieving the required. Do let me know which one to push. I prefer the latter one since combobox consistency will be preserved along with no increase in dependency.
